intro: Pisonia hassleriana, commonly known as the red pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting birds and insects. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy texture. Pisonia hassleriana thrives in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny habitats.
